rcompass 0.0.1
  • Get started
  • Reference

Get all available platforms for the selected compendium, use get_compendia to check all the available compendia

get_platforms.Rd

Get all available platforms for the selected compendium, use get_compendia to check all the available compendia

get_platforms(compendium = "vitis_vinifera")

Arguments

compendium

a character - the selected compendium

Value

a data.frame with 4 columns: platformAccessId, platformName, description, dataSource, platformType

Examples

get_platforms()

#> 3  Affymetrix submissions are typically submitted to GEO using the GEOarchive method described at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/geo/info/geo_affy.html The GeneChipÂ® Vitis vinifera Genome Array is the first array to provide comprehensive coverage of the V. vinifera genome. 14,000 V. vinifera transcripts and 1,700 transcripts from other Vitis species can be interrogated. Oligonucleotide probes complementary to each corresponding sequence are synthesized in situ on the arrays. Sixteen pairs of oligonucleotide probes are used to measure the level of transcription of each sequence represented on the GeneChipÂ® Vitis vinifera (Grape) Genome Array. Sequences used in the design of the V. vinifera Genome Array were selected from GenBankÂ®, dbEST, and RefSeq. The sequence clusters were created from the UniGene database (Build 7, Oct 2003). Annotations derived from Affymetrix CSV file dated 6/23/2004

#> 13                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Affymetrix custom tiling array - GrapeGen. The chip contains 23096 probe sets (40% increment with respect to the commercially availabe Grape Genechip.  The probe sets represent Vitis vinifera consensus sequences (when overlapped) from Cabernet Sauvignon, Muscat Hamburg, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Shiraz. See the <a href="http://www.bcgsc.ca/project/genomics-of-berry-quality-in-grapevine-grapegen-1">GrapeGen project</a> for further information. The CDF file is available for download on the ArrayExpress FTP site.

#> 17               Array Manufacturer: NimbleGen, Catalogue number: 05224691001, Distribution: custom-commercial, Technology: in situ oligonucleotide, 12-plex array with 135,000 features per subarray. Feature size: 12 um Array is based on the V1 gene prediction by CRIBI of the 12X grape genome assembly produced by the French-Italian consortium.<br>Comment[V1] = Vitis genome 12X annotation V1 ID (http://genomes.cribi.unipd.it/DATA/V1/)<br>Reporter Database Entry [genbank] = Protein accession LINK_PRE:http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sites/entrez?db=protein&cmd=search&term=<br>Reporter Sequence = Oligo sequence<br>Comment[GENE_CALL_ID] = Gene Call ID as identified by NimbleScan software. This ADF includes roughly 750 extra probes not on A-GEOD-13936. These probes causing are for the random genes (some of the genes of grapevine are on random chromosomes because we can't accurately place them in the genome).
#> 18                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     The microarray was made with 14562 distinct 70-mer oligonucleotide probes from the Qiagen/Operon Array-Ready Oligo SetTM for the Grape Genome Version 1.0. The set represents 14562 transcripts from the The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR) Grape Gene Index release 3. The oligonucleotide probes were spotted on mirro slides.
